page.title: 16TALES OF OLD ASHBY CONTD.
page.content: In 1827 the Market Cross in Market Street was pulled down.It is believed that two residents Mr Woolet and John Eames arrived at the dead of night after the nightwatchman had passed and fastened chains round the pillers of the Cross,fixing them to their horses. With much encouragement the Cross came down.The noise awakened most people except a Mr Proudman_he was wakened by a neighbour throwing stones at his bedroom window.The call went out "Get up,get up they have taken down the Market Cross". Mr Proudman got up very quickly, in fact too quickly, for in his great hurry to get up he fell downstairs and broke his neck.
